paper_abstract: We present a versatile Monte Carlo method for estimating multidimensional integrals, with applications to rare-event probability estimation. The method fuses two distinct and popular Monte Carlo simulation methods-Markov chain Monte Carlo and importance sampling-into a single algorithm. We show that for some applied numerical examples the proposed Markov Chain importance sampling algorithm performs better than methods based solely on importance sampling or MCMC.
paper_title: Markov chain importance sampling with applications to rare event probability estimation
